data.title: The Moultrie Observer
data.meta_description: Henry Lewis passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the The Moultrie Observer on 2017-05-24.
data.text:
Henry Albert Lewis, 88, of Moultrie, passed away on Wednesday, May 24, 2017 at his residence.

Funeral services will be held at 4:00 PM Friday, May 26, 2017 in the chapel of Baker Funeral Home with the Rev. Donnie Lewis, Rev. Terry Webb and John Stephenson officiating. Interment with Military honors will follow at Baker/Hillcrest Memorial Gardens. Casketbearers will be John Stephenson, Wyatt Crapps, Buddy Lewis, Chris Wynn, Tony Bivins Jr., Johnny Lewis, Bo Jenkins, Tracy Cosper.

Born on October 7, 1928 in Sylvester, Georgia, he was the son of the late William Henry Lewis Sr. and Katherine Katie Eady Lewis. He was a retired truck driver, a veteran of the United States Navy and was a member of the Assembly of God.

In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by his daughter, Barbara Gail Lewis Wynn; grandson, Casey Lewis; brothers, John Henry Lewis, Henry Talmadge Lewis, William Edward Lewis, and William Henry Lewis Jr.; and sister, Pearline Lewis McCellan and Lillie Vie Lewis Cosper.

Survivors include his wife of 68 years, Mary Christine Lamb Lewis of Moultrie; son, Danny Lee Lewis, and wife Virginia of Moultrie; daughters, Vickie Carol Lewis Jenkins and husband Tommy of Moultrie, and Lorie Katherine Lewis Stephenson; son in law, James Wynn of Pensacola, FL;10 grandchildren; 19 great grandchildren; and 8 great-great grandchildren.

Visitation will be one hour prior to the service, from 3pm-4pm in the chapel of Baker Funeral Home. A special thanks to nieces, Connie Richter, Shirley Gordon, and all the Colquitt Regional Hospice nurses and aides for all their love and support.

The family may be contacted at the home of Tommy and Vickie Jenkins, 138 Bennett Rd. Coolidge, GA 31738.

Arrangements have been entrusted to Baker Funeral Home.

Published on May 24, 2017

Note: These are general guidelines; some florists may not be able to operate within these timelines. During peak periods such as Valentineâ€™s Day, Memorial Day and most holidays, florists are not always able to keep up to demand. Tribute will contact you if there are any issues.

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
